question: What is a type of a landslide in which slipping of several units of rock debris occurs with a backward rotation with respect to the slope over which the movement takes place?
explanation:
Landslides is a process in which the materials involved are relatively dry. Landslides are classified into - Rock slide, slump and debris slide.Â 
Slump is a type of a landslide in which slipping of several units of rock debris occurs with a backward rotation with respect to the slope over which the movement takes place.
